metadata.commander_name: Lieutenant-General Sir Alan Gordon Cunningham (18 Nov - 26 Nov 1941), then Lieutenant-General Neil Methuen Ritchie (26 Nov 1941 - )

narrative.title: Eighth Army 8Th Army - 1941Q4
narrative.situation: British Theater Command - Desert Army deployed in North Africa during 1941Q4.
narrative.objectives: Theater-level field army conducting mobile offensive operations in North African desert. Mission: Relieve besieged Tobruk garrison, destroy Axis armored forces, recapture Cyrenaica.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Coastal plain (Tobruk area) transitioning to rocky desert plateau (Cyrenaican plateau) and sand desert (Libyan Desert to south). Escarpments and wadis create natural defensive positions.

special_rules: Long-range desert operations with extended supply lines
Integration of Commonwealth forces (British, Indian, New Zealand, South African, Polish)

environment.terrain_type: Coastal plain (Tobruk area) transitioning to rocky desert plateau (Cyrenaican plateau) and sand desert (Libyan Desert to south). Escarpments and wadis create natural defensive positions.
